title: Task 1: Identify selected object
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT provide two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art.
Response provides two accurate identifiers for the selected work of art.

title: Task 2: Describe visual characteristics of a work of art
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe specific VISUAL characteristics of the Forbidden City.
Response accurately describes ONE specific VISUAL characteristic of the Forbidden City.

title: Task 3: Describe visual characteristics of a work of art.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe specific VISUAL characteristics of the selected work.
Response accurately describes ONE specific VISUAL characteristic of the selected work.

title: Task 4: Explain how two or more works of art are similar in how they convey meaning.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use VISUAL evidence from both works to explain a similarity in how both works of architecture communicated ideals of power.
Response accurately uses VISUAL evidence from both works to explain ONE similarity in how both works of architecture communicated ideals of power.

title: Task 5: Explain how two or more works of art are different in how they convey meaning.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: Response does NOT use accurately use CONTEXTUAL evidence from both works to explain a difference in how both works of architecture communicated ideals of power within their respective cultures.
Response accurately uses CONTEXTUAL evidence from both works to explain ONE difference in how both architectural works communicated ideals of power.
